title: My DSAN 5000 Lab 3 Assignment
text:

After studying statistics in undergrad and starting this degree, I have begun to see Baye’s Theorem, \(\Pr(A \mid B) = \frac{\Pr(B \mid A)\Pr(A)}{\Pr(B)}\), in my sleep! But if \(\Pr(A)\) and \(\Pr(B)\) are independent or mutually exclusive, who cares! Still, you can do some pretty fun things with Baye’s Theorem. Like the transformation below:
\[\Pr(A \mid B) = \frac{\Pr(B \mid A)\Pr(A)}{\Pr(B)} = \frac{\Pr(A \cap B)}{\Pr(B)}\]



It’s always important to both cite and footnote your text, the extra information and content will surely help the reader if they have questions1.
If you ever include a quote in you’re writing, unless you mention the speaker or author, you should definitely add a footnote for the source. For instance, someone once said:

“Once upon a time, a time waltzed upon a clock”2

In response to this thought-provoking message, someone responded with:

“I do”3




Here are some sports graphics I made using photoshop when I was a student at the University of Michigan.



National Championship Template for the Michigan Wrestling Team





Olympic Templates for Michigan Wrestlers


And here is a video of one of my favorite moments as a student at Michigan.









flowchart LR
  A[Wake Up] --> B(Eat Food)
  B --> C{Decide Plans}
  C --> D[Do Schoolwork]
  C --> E[Watch TV]
  C --> F[Sleep]


 A Mermaid diagram of the difficult decisions I have to make every day. 



Not mentioned in the mermaid diagram above is the decision to spend time thinking about football. According to recent studies (Kuzmits and Adams 2008), thinking about football increases IQ exponentially.
